text: St Thomas' Hospital is a hospital in central London on the river Thames. In 1860 it was used to train nurses as a part of the Nightingale training academy made by Florence Nightingale. It is now part of the Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust, together with Guy's Hospital and King's College Hospital. == References == Category:University hospitals in the United Kingdom Category:Buildings and structures in the London Borough of Southwark
